STATE OF MICHIGAN
GRETCHEN WHITMER DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES ROBERT GORDON
GOVERNOR DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING DIRECTOR
LANSING
December 2, 2019
Stephanie Dettloff
Child & Family Services - Northeast Michigan
1044 US-23 N
Alpena, MI 49707
RE: License #: CB040201041
Investigation #: 2019C0114036
Child & Family Services - Northeast Michigan
Dear Ms. Dettloff:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 Repeat violations require an explanation as to why the previous corrective
action plan failed to prevent a repeat violationof the rule.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
611 W. OTTAWA  P.O. BOX 30664  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov/lara  517-335-1980

If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MSA and your
contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram, Area Manager, at 616-552-3662.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 383-5531
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CB040201041
Investigation #: 2019C0114036
Complaint Receipt Date: 07/10/2019
Investigation Initiation Date: 07/10/2019
Report Due Date: 09/08/2019
Licensee Name: Child Family Services of NE Michigan
Licensee Address: 1044 US-23 N
Alpena, MI 49707
Licensee Telephone #: 989-356-4567
Administrator: Stephanie Dettloff, Designee
Licensee Designee: Stephanie Dettloff, Designee
Name of Facility: Child & Family Services - Northeast Michigan
Facility Address: 1044 US-23 N
Alpena, MI 49707
Facility Telephone #: (989) 356-4567
Original Issuance Date: 05/01/1990
License Status: REGULAR
Effective Date: 12/21/2018
Expiration Date: 12/20/2020
Capacity: Unknown
Program Type: CHILD PLACING AGENCY, PRIVATE
1

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
It is alleged that the agency failed to complete special Yes
investigations for three foster homes within the time frames
specified by the rule.
It is alleged that the agency did not complete thorough special Yes
investigations of foster homes.
Additional Findings Yes
III. METHODOLOGY
07/10/2019 Special Investigation Intake
2019C0114036
07/10/2019 Special Investigation Initiated - Telephone
11/04/2019 Contact - Face to Face
Staff interview
11/04/2019 Contact - Document Received
11/04/2019 Inspection Completed-BCAL Sub. Compliance
11/04/2019 Exit Conference
NOTE: The name of the Child and Family Services Northeast staff is coded
throughout this report to ensure privacy and confidentiality.
ALLEGATION:
It is alleged that the agency failed to complete special investigations for three foster
homes within the time frames specified by the rule.
INVESTIGATION:
On 07/10/19 this writer initiated a special investigation regarding the allegation
described above. The Chief Administrator of the agency was interviewed.
2

Documents were also reviewed. What follows is information obtained from the
aforementioned sources.
On 07/10/19 the Chief Administrator was informed of the allegations.
On 11-4-19 the Chief Administrator was interviewed on site. The Chief Administrator
acknowledged that special investigations had been overdue but had been
completed. The Chief Administrator reported that staff turnover had contributed to
the late completion of the investigations.
This writer then conducted a review of foster home files and various documents.
1. Foster Home 1 (CF040385588). A special investigation, #2018C062412, was
opened on 11/09/17 and the special investigation was closed on 12/14/18. The
special investigation and the corrective action plan addressing rule violations
were found in the MISACWIS system.
2. Foster Home 2 (CF600339427). A special investigation, #2016C0621807 was
initiated on 01/28/16 and a DHHS-259 closing the investigation was found in the
electronic file. The DHHS-259 indicates that the investigation was closed on
02/23/16. The electronic file did not contain the special investigation. The Chief
Administrator looked for a “hard copy” of the investigation but reported that there
was no report or documentation that the investigation had been completed other
that the DHHS-259 closing the investigation.
3. Foster Home 3 (CF040317197), was closed on 02/21/19. There were 3 special
investigations that were not completed as required by the rule.
Special investigation #2018C0624674 was opened on 01/25/18, not completed,
and closed on 12/12/18.
Special investigation #2016C0622041 was opened on 04/14/16, not completed,
and closed on 12/14/18.
Special Investigation #2016C0622452 was opened on 06/14/16, not completed,
and closed on 12/14/18.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(3) An agency shall complete a special evaluation within 45
calendar days after receipt of the information. If additional
time is required, then the agency shall inform the foster
parent, in writing, of the basis for the extension and the
expected length of the extension. The total time for the
3

completion of the investigation shall not exceed 90
calendar days without written approval from the chief
administrator or his or her designee.
ANALYSIS: Special Investigation #2018C0622412, for Foster Home 1, was
completed late by approximately 1 year.
Special Investigation # 2016C0621807 for Foster Home 2 was
not completed. A completed investigation and report could not
be located. Foster Home 2 is an open licensed foster home. The
agency will be required to complete this investigation and the
corrective action plan should reflect this.
Special investigations # 2018C0624674, #2016C0622041, and
#2016C0622452 for Foster Home 3 were late. Since the foster
home is closed, completion of the special investigations cannot
be achieved. The agency will be required to submit a corrective
action plan which prevents late special investigations.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION:
It is alleged that the agency did not complete thorough special investigations of
foster homes.
INVESTIGATION:
Special investigations #2018C0624674, #2016C0622041, and #2016C0622452, for
Foster Home 3, were closed without having been completed. The following language
was used throughout each of the 3 investigation reports where answers to questions
contained on the CWL-4005 are required;
“08/16/2018 - this is unknown. The worker and supervisor no longer work for this
agency.
Closing this SE in order to close the license on this home. Child was removed, per
foster parent's request, at the time the investigation was initiated.”
4

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in
the agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(c) Conduct a thorough investigation including all
necessary collateral contacts.
ANALYSIS: Each of the 3 special investigations for Foster Home 3 were
closed without having been completed while the foster home
was still open. The justification for not completing the
investigations was that agency personnel who had opened the
investigations no longer worked for the agency and the agency
wanted to close the license.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
During the course of this investigation the license recommendations resulting from
the special investigations were reviewed. The three investigations for Foster Home 3
documented the following license recommendations.
Special Investigation # 2018C0624674. The DHHS-259 for this investigation
documented, “Continue current status”.
Special investigation #2016C0622041. The DHHS-259 for this investigation
documented “Continue current status”.
Special Investigation # 2016C0622452. The DHHS-259 for this investigation
documented “Denial of issuance”.
The licensing recommendation stemming from special investigation
#2016C0621807 for Foster Home 2 documents on the DHHS-259, “Continue
current status”.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12325 License recommendation.
(1) An agency shall recommend to the department the
appropriate licensing action consistent with facts
5

contained in the foster home evaluation and any special
evaluations.
ANALYSIS: The three special investigations for Foster Home 3 and the one
special investigation for Foster Home 2 were not completed.
Therefore, the licensing recommendations based upon those
investigations were not based on the facts of the circumstances
being investigated, rather ease of completion for the worker, as
clearly noted in the 3 investigations for Foster Home 3.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDING:
During the course of the interview with the Chief Administrator she had reported that
the special investigations that are the focus of this investigation had been completed.
An email dated 12/06/18 from the DCWL Assistant Director to the Agency Chief
Administrator and Licensing Supervisor details the process for completing the special
investigations. The special investigation for Foster Home 2 had not been completed
from the date of the 12/06/18 email until the 11/04/19 on site visit by this writer. The
three investigations for Foster Home 3 had not been completed from the date of the
12/06/19 email until the home closed on 02/21/19. The DHHS-259’s for each of the
investigations for Foster Homes 2 and 3 recommended licensing action incongruent
with the incomplete investigations.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12207 Staff responsibilities.
1) An agency shall designate that the chief administrator is
responsible for the day-to-day operation of the agency and
for ensuring compliance with the applicable provisions of
these rules.
ANALYSIS: The Chief Administrator failed to ensure that the special
investigations were completed initially, but also from the date of
the DCWL Assistant Directors directives on 12/06/18. In
addition, licensing recommendations were made based upon
incomplete investigations.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan the recommendation is for
continuance of the regular license.
November 12, 2019
________________________________________
Doug Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
December 2, 2019
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
